text.text_translated: Wasfia Nazreen first saw a hula hoop when she was a young girl. A hula hoop is a large plastic ring that you spin around your body. She saw a foreign child playing with one in her native Bangladesh. Wasfia reluctantly watched, as people in her country believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now, Wasfia is one of the few people in the world who have climbed the Seven Summits, including Everest and Kilimanjaro. She is also the first person to hula-hoop on each peak. She did this to give women and girls more confidence and strength in a country which discourages them from doing sport.
